Reviews.Title: “the essence of old tobacco pipe”
Reviews.Author: saint77777
Reviews.Content: I think this is the air freshener used throughout the hotel, just awful. Otherwise the hotel was quite decent but hard to get over being nauseous due to constant odor. This one of those smells almost impossible to be rid of, so this will be my first and last visit to HI Safa

Reviews.Title: “Lobby is nice.....that's it”
Reviews.Author: rcgiggles
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with colleagues on a business trip for 7 days. I checked reviews here, even though I did.n't have a choice in hotels. Here are my comments: 1. Lobby was modern and nicely decorated 2. Free breakfast daily (only meal served in dining room, no room service but delivery from restaurants is available). 3. Front desk staff was pretty nice. 4. Like others mentioned, due to location there are no supermarkets, convenience stores or restaurants close by. A colleague did say there was a small cafe in the business park directly across from the hotel though. There are also no vending machines so if you want to purchase drinks and snacks, there's a selected variety in an area next to the front desk for purchase. 5. Rooms are on the smaller side, but I've actually had worse lol My room had stains on the carpet where you could tell there was an overflow from the bathroom. There is no heat in the room, just A/C. Though it makes sense because of the weather there, it was actually cool at night during our stay in early March and I could've used some heat. Bathroom is decent size, but shower stall is on the smaller side but still workable. And there are no small amenities like lotions, shampoos etc but they do provide a body/hair cleanser in the shower. Bed was super firm, pillows soft and not flat sheet, only comforter. Again, this is probably due to the hot weather, but I did receive a blanket for the cooler nights. 6. There is NO WIFI in the rooms only hardwire, they provide cable. It was reliable and several colleagues had difficulty with connects. The staff worked on it all week with no success. Wifi is available in the lobby but you have to pay for it. 7. They provide shuttle service that leaves at 10:30am and will take you to either the Dubai Mall or the beach. Pickup is at 3:30pm. There are also taxi's available and the metro station is about a 15 min walk. If I had th e choice, I wouldn't stay here again, but it's OK if you're on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: MilesDoha
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights in March 2012 and found the hotel very clean and comfortable with a courteous staff. The location is not ideal, but the price is quite good for Dubai. The morning free breakfast offers plenty of choice (eggs, cereal, cheese, juices, coffee, etc.with breads, toast, rolls, buns.Lots of Americans and Europeans stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Samer A
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very excellent because of the staff and management which make me feel like my home. They are very professional, Friendly, worm welcome and hospitality. Excellent breakfast, efficient service, the rooms are very nice, comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: josmon10
Reviews.Content: Dubai is not a cheap place for hotels, and even less during international trade shows, so I was pleasantly surprised to find the Holiday Inn Express Safa Park for less than AED 400 per night; my colleagues a couple of stations nearer World Trade Centre paid twice that much. Internet is quite expensive though, especially if you're staying for several days, but as a Platinum member of Priority Club I got it for free, so I can't complain. Location is good enough. Business Bay metro station looks quite near, but once you get there you must go up, walk to the other side of Sheikh Zayed Road, escalators down, and up again. It never took me less than 10 minutes to reach the platform, but that's not a great problem. As for the hotel, it doesn't stray much from the typical Holiday Inn Express. Breakfast was OK, although with the fair beginning at 11:00 and the breakfast from 6:30 to 9:30, everyone got there at the same time and they couldn't quite handle it. On the other hand, I once had dinner and followed the advice of another reviewer. I can confirm that the fish was pretty good! I guess I'll be coming back next time I'm in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at Holiday Inn Express - Safa Park”
Reviews.Author: Mohammad1972
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Holiday Inn Express - Safa Papk during my last business trip to Dubai, the experience was great. The hotel location is in the middle of Dubai close to Dubai trade center where I spent most of the time; with easy access to transportation. Rooms are clean and the service is great although budgeted hotel.

Reviews.Title: “There are better choices for the same price.”
Reviews.Author: LePires
Reviews.Content: I travel to Dubai kinda often. I always stay in hotels from the same category of the HI Express, which means, 2-3 stars, all the same price in average. This time I chose HI Express Safa once I'm a gold member of IC Hotels Group, I'd earn points, so OK, I decided staying there. I arrived at 3PM. There were no rooms available, I had to wait until almost 5PM to get a room, which was not really cleaned (dirty carpets). There were many other people seated waiting cleaned rooms as well. The excuse I received from staff is that "the other people took much longer to leave the rooms". Well, this is their problem to push late people to get out of the rooms isn't it? Breakfast was poor as well, the basic of the basic (OK, I know this is not a 5 star hotel, but as I said, other 2 stars hotels from Dubai offers much more for the same price). Apart from that, staff from restaurant are really slow, either to clean tables or replace food. I had to wait to seat, everybody had to wait 20 minutes to have some food replaced in Breakfast, in a huge line. Staff from reception did what they could to be nice, but the hotel would need much more employees. Internet was really slow, wifi only downstairs. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Three essentials out of five”
Reviews.Author: Snookoafc1
Reviews.Content: The HIE at Safa Park in Dubai is in the Business Bay area, so hardly a resort sector of the town. That means guests are essentially there on business. There are five essentials to the business traveler: A comfortable room, a work area in the room, tea and coffee making facilities in the room, internet connection and a decent breakfast. Safa Park Holiday Inn Express only managed the first three. The internet was a disaster. First, they charge for it, which as all businessmen know (and almost certainly agree) is a rip-off as it costs an hotel nothing. But I have never staying in a HIE yet where it was charged for in the lobby too. But Safa Park does charge and very largely, it doesn't work. In the room connection has to be by cable and they demand a deposit for it - and then it still doesn't connect. The front desk, after much messing around finally came up with alternative routes to get to a connection, which had to be in the restaurant as it was impossible to balance a laptop on those low couches in the lobby....not impressed. If I have to pay for it at all, then I expect to be able to connect in my room. And breakfast...why only provide hard boiled eggs? The much-advertised free breakfast at HIE includes baked beans, turkey bacon (tasteless, don't know why they can't serve real bacon when most of the kitchen staff are not actually Muslim), and hard boiled eggs! Why can't they make scrambled like other HIE locations? I would rather pay and get the day off to a decent start. Otherwise, it is the usual model for HIE, generally one of my favoured locations because it is reasonably-priced and you know you will get a reasonable sleep and can make tea in your room (powdered milk, unfortunately, but you can usually scrounge some). But it was $250 a night! For that, I expect a decent breakfast AND free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Budget redefined!! even for a 2 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NP K
Reviews.Content: Most un-comfortable stay of my life...rooms are damp...fridges in the rooms don't work (despite 2 room changes)...horrible interior...a awful cardboard box for a toilet/shower room! overall disappointed but whatelse to expect from a 2 star hotel! I wasn't able to sleep due to the racket of kids and slamming doors all night...it was just the worst ever! After 1 night I decided to move hotels Pullman Mall of Emirates might have cost 4x as much but it was money well spent! never using this hotel ever again!

Reviews.Title: “pre stay before joining a cruise”
Reviews.Author: mollie4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights prior to joining a cruise, adequate for our needs, buffet breakfast was excellent, also had a lunch one day which was very acceptable, room probably similar to those of a budget hotel but fine for a short stay. Area was in among the business skyscrappers area but this was not a problem for us as on the one whole day we were picked up and dropped off at our hotel for excersions, and on the 2nd day got a taxi to the cruise terminal - if we wanted to stay in Dubai again for a longer period would chose a hotel nearer the creek so that we had somewhere to go for a walk around.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST place to stay in while in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Hasan K
Reviews.Content: A great hotel run by a very efficient manager. Central location and very friendly service. The value for money cannot be compared to anywhere else. Rooms have just what you need and nothing less. Loved every minute of staying there. Will keep going back

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in every way.”
Reviews.Author: Pookie2199
Reviews.Content: A very large Holiday Inn Express which is a great place to stay. Staff are very friendly and helpful and a free shuttle bus is available to take you to the Dubai Mall or the beach. Dinner in the restaurant was good and it has a bar, but I never was anyone in there. It’s a 500 metre walk to the train station which is a great way to get around Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: andyq8
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for I think 7-8nights, wow dont think too much go for this hotel. Breakfast is excellent, location is excellent. Price is excellent !!! we booked through booking@bestdubaiholidays.com if we go back there inshallah we will stay in Safa Holiday Inn again!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: evawie
Reviews.Content: You shouldn't expect too much from this hotel for the price you pay. Yet we were pleased by the breakfast, the room space and cleanliness. We were only there for one night and the hotel seemed OK. I would go back there.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Value but with caveat”
Reviews.Author: Vsum
Reviews.Content: Once you checked-in you have been forgotten, even you should not expect a better room than match box type. I believe as this is a budget executive hotel, you have to accept it. Room cleanliness, service at reception, breakfasts and free stuff for Priority Card Member are augmenting. For me location of hotel is a major plus and staff service (selectively) is major minus, I believe they are not well trained (again not all). Being bang next to sheikh zayed road, Dubai Mall, Burj Khalifa was delighting in the city of confusing roads and easy to approach my tourist destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staffs”
Reviews.Author: eyaredo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located 46.50 AED away from the airport( terminal 3). The room is minimal and clean. If you go to Dubai and your major business is around Dubai Mall that is fine. If you have business around Diera you better stay in other place. The staffs are so cooperative and humble. The breakfast is good. I like it anyways.By the way I left my watch in the room when I check out and they gave me when I went back to ask for it. The other thing is the way they numbered the rooms is odd. Odd and even numbered rooms are arranged in different sides.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarolynChester
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, nice and clean. Expensive and very slow internet, printer did not work either. Good choice of breakfast. Near Safa Park, but taxis are available from outside hotel at reasonable prices. Use the metered taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!!”
Reviews.Author: PankajB97
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property recently in December 2011. It is located around 5-10 mins from Dubai Mall / Burj Khalifa but on the opposite side of Sheikh Zayed Road and hence there are'nt any Restaraunts, eating out options available within walking distance of the hotel. Hotel has commplimentary shuttle service to Zumeirha Beach and Dubai Mall everyday in the morning. Hotel staff is quick & efficient. They accomodated my request of early check-in and late check-out without any fuss which was really nice of them. Rooms are of decent size and have all required amenities. Breakfast buffet is ordinary with very limited options repeated daily. Since its a no-frill hotel, there is no room service. Overall this is great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good cheap layover hotel”
Reviews.Author: Naturegirl70
Reviews.Content: We had a layover in Dubai but didn't want to spend a lot of money for a hotel but also didn't want to stay right at the airport. We found Holiday Inn Express at Safa Park and it was great. We got the 40th Anniversary special rate which included free breakfast and lunch and late checkout (4pm). Excellent since we had a 7pm flight and didn't want to pay extra charges to extend our room a few hours. Nothing fancy about this place but meals were adequate and the gym facilities were good considering it was a Holiday Inn express. Nothing is nearby and you will need transportation to get anywhere. It won't be a long taxi ride but you will still need to pay for one. Also, normally you pay extra for internet but the manager gave it to us for free because we were a Points member- so good to ask. One thing that is negative about this location for a cheap layover is that it still costs about 50 Dirham Taxi ride each way to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to stay in for an inexpensive price”
Reviews.Author: adougla2
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easily accessible by public transportation. We liked staying there since it was a reasonable price and could accommodate three of us in one room. The shuttle was handy to go to the beach, although thirty minutes late to pick us up on the return trip. The breakfast that is included was sufficient but nothing amazing. The staff was nice, but oddly unfamiliar with some of the things we were seeking direction to go to. Lastly, the internet was annoying. It was in the lobby only and the time you purchased was only able to used within 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “When your company is counting the pennies”
Reviews.Author: LeBonk
Reviews.Content: This is a typical business stopover for poverino companies. It does have shuttle busses and decent all round facilities for a solo traveler. Hey, it’s a Holiday Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Average rooms, bad house keeping.”
Reviews.Author: gary25
Reviews.Content: Positives of being here: 1. Location ain't bad. It's off Sheikh Zayed Road. 2. Business Bay metro station is 2 mins walk so that is convenient. 3. Average breakfast with reasonable variety of food 4. Helpful reception staff Negatives: 1. Match box size rooms. 2. No Room service (understood since it's Express) 3. Bad house keeping. We waited for more than 12 hrs for 2 glasses to arrive to our room and finally gave up. I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD STAY OVERALL BUT BE WARNED ABOUT TAXI SCAM”
Reviews.Author: lestasupra
Reviews.Content: Before i talk about my substantive stay, i would like to warn all fellow travellers of a "scam" taking place which dupes guests at this hotel. It involves the security staff at the front of this hotel who lead guests to private taxis waiting directly outside the hotel. Guests are lied to and told that these taxis cost the same as WHITE GOVERNMENT CABS. This is a lie, these private cabs are much more expensive than WHITE GOVERNMENT CABS. The security staff tolf myself and several other guests that the private cabs are the same cost as WHITE GOVERNMENT CABS, AND THIS IS A LIE. I also heard these unscrupolous security staff telling guests that WHITE GOVERNMENT CABS ARE NOT READILY AVAILABLE IN THE LOCAL AREA. This again is a lie. I WANT TO WARN ALL GUESTS OF THIS SCAM SO YOU CAN AVOID BEING A VICTIM. MY ADVICE TO YOU IS TO FLAG DOWN A WHITE GOVERNMENT CAB OUTSIDE THE HOTEL YOURSELF. THEY ARE READILY AVAILABLE WITHIN A COUPLE OF MINS AT THE ROADSIDE. ONLY GOVERNMENT CABS ARE WHITE SO STICK WITH WHITE CABS THROUGHOUT YOUR STAY. I saw the secutiy staff making a note every time they managed to get a guset into a private cab. My hypothesis is that the security staff are receiving a commission from their "friends" driving these pricate cabs. REMEMBER PRIVATE CABS ARE NOT WHITE. I informed the hotel manager of these issues on 20/11/2011 and he said this problem would be addressed that night. So i was shocked to observe that on the following day the SCAM was continuing. I managed to advise a few guests who were angry and shocked and decided to take government cabs. REMEMBER FOR CHEAP TRANSPORT USE WHITE GOVERNMENT CABS OR THE EXCELLENT METRO SYSTEM. HOLIDAY INN SENIOR MANAGEMENT YOU NEED TO DEAL WITH THE ISSUE ABOVE EFFICIENTLY. I would have given this hotel four out of five but due to the avove issue i have had to mark it down. In terms of my stay the hotel maids on my floor and receptionists were good overall. Check in could have been quicker when i arrived at the hotel at 3am, the reception staff prioritised answering the phone than dealing with checking me in when i was tired from a long flight. After this they were much better and helpful throughout my stay. The maids who cleaned our room were good overall. However, when i inspected my room closely i found a plastic bag behind the sofa and a lot of dust behind and under the bed. Also my sheets were not changed sometimes when they needed changing. But again i would stay that aside from these issues the maids were friendly and good at maing up our room. The hotel is in a quiet location but close to majot landmarks and an excellent metro system. Wi fi should be available in rooms and should be cheaper or free. Breakfast is good.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel which is Value for money”
Reviews.Author: rpatel54
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel in Dubai is one of the oldest Holiday Inn, the place is still in good condition and manintained well. The rooms were reasonably spacious but very clean. The Gym facility was adequate and we liked the complimentary bus service offered to Jumeraih Beach abd Dubai mall The breakfast offerred was excellent. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The Metro was only 5 mins walk from the hotel so it was easy to go around places

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING EXPERIENCE!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kumar1082
Reviews.Content: I had made a last minute reservation to Dubai with my family and I agreed to this hotel just by the name of Holiday Inn. But the risk was worth it. The hotel was amazing, though budgeted it's rooms were great and the hospitality was overwhelming! It is centrally located close to the Dubai Mall, Jumairah Beach and the Metro station. The cabs are available 24*7 just by a phone call. Overall though a budgeted hotel but worth the money spent. A thumbs up for family stay and solo for short trips!!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: danielbochi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good, the room for me was perfect, good enough, clean, quiet, very nice furniture, good shower, breakfast was also good, but everyday was the same products, they could improve it and change some of them during the week, the location is quite good once the hotel is about 1km from the MTR. The staffs are okay, they could be more friendly. I would say the cost is fair for what they offer, be carefull, Dubai is a very hot city, if you stay in somewhere where the AC doesn't work properly you will be in trouble to sleep. I would recommend the hotel, it was a great experience, I enjoyed my stay at Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: LeMonde_at_lemonicks
Reviews.Content: The hotel is reasonably priced and very clean. Good rooms but not very big. You have to pay astronomical amounts for Internet. Only a couple of staff were very efficient , others looked as if they were new in the job Not many good TV channels , but being Indian I found a few Indian channels. Break fast spread was reasonably good but for Dinner, the choices were pretty limited and added to that is there are no good restaurants in the vicinity. You have to travel 4-5 Kilometers to find one. or go to the Dubai Mall. They do have a good lounge bar and happy hours :) A slightly out of place but , Since i had work in the neighborhood this was certainly convenient. Definitlely a NO for a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Sleep only Basis”
Reviews.Author: Ali S
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for two nights. The hotel is perfect for Sleep only basis. Clean rooms and good size bed in the twin room. If you plan to spend the whole day out, then this is the perfect place to stay. The location is perfect and you can reach all attractions easily, e.g. Dubai Mall (Burj Khalifah), Mall of Emirates (ski Dubai), Bur Dubai, Deera, etc. They have breakfast included with the rate, but do not expect much! It's very basic and I prefer to have breakfast a restaurant outside. The TV was very old, and I believe they should have LCD TVs, I cannot believe this kind of TVs still exist anymore! In short, Clean room, good bed, excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Great, cheap hotel, perfect stopover spot!”
Reviews.Author: ChapLeeds
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, clean and friendly what more do you expect for 340 AED a night with brekkie and Internet? A spacious enough room with sofa. Bar fridge is empty so can chill own pop etc. Spotless bathroom, nice power shower! No pool, so not so great for longer stays perhaps? Free shuttle to Dubai mall or beach club, can walk to train and taxi drivers know hotel so transport easy! Cheap and clean....spend the money you'd waste on a 5 star in the never ending malls!

Reviews.Title: “very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: KB95_11
Reviews.Content: We spend recently 4 days at the hotel. Staff has been most helpful and very friendly. We were for example allowed to check in already at 6.30 am after arriving early from a long-distance flight. We could also make some print outs using the reception´s printer. Beds were extremely comfortable. Breakfast was free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “You'll get what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: Mitch_Bal
Reviews.Content: The interior of the lobby is nice. I like the restaurant behind the reception area, they serve good and affordable dishes. The rooms are quite small. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from the nearest metro station. The breakfast is just like any ordinary continental breakfast nothing fancy mostly bread and fruits. When we transferred to another IHG property during our stay last January we forgot one of our luggage at the concierge. The bag wasn't labeled and we were able to retrieve it after 3 days. Thanks for their great staff

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for business”
Reviews.Author: adood
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very suitable for business men, as their service, staff, comfort, location, all are excellent. I am very satisfied with my experience in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service with a SMILE!”
Reviews.Author: AAHinojos
Reviews.Content: The most impressive attribute of this hotel is their staff – professional yet very friendly. They serve you with a smile and this positive attitude is consistent throughout the hotel and during our stay. The Duty Manager, Ms Stella, particularly stood out as she welcomed us warmly upon check-in, gave us a room with a good view, and even phoned our room to greet me on my birthday. PROS: Hotel new and in a quiet location, close to shopping malls Facilities, particularly room and restaurant, very clean Bed linen new and fresh, bathroom very clean Continental breakfast served between 6AM and 11AM on a Friday, fresh and replenished even at past 10AM Secure parking available, easy access from parking to lobby to room CONS: Entrance to parking narrow and tight No wash cloths in bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for its category!”
Reviews.Author: StudentOnTravels
Reviews.Content: Nice lobby, nice staff, nice room, nice bath room, decent breakfast; excellent value and location, pretty close to most of the Dubai attractions. Everything was very clean, all staff have a permanent smile and are very professional. Do not hesitate in booking this for a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Jacky C
Reviews.Content: No problems. Quiet, free Wifi, nice basic breakfast in my room price. Room is quiet (key!) and comfortable to work. Best of all you are in centre of Dubai and cheap to take taxi everywhere. Taxis are a bit hard to come by so worst case walk out of hotel up the street to catch one every few minutes. You can spend more in Dubai but why?

Reviews.Title: “You know what to expect - and it delivers”
Reviews.Author: CovertedPoms
Reviews.Content: Took a taxi from the airport and arrived at 0130 - taxi fare was very reasonable, just under 60 Dirham (about £9.00 or €9.20). Check in was efficient and uncomplicated. Air conditioning was efficient and very welcome. The room was everything you expect in a new Holiday Inn Express; clean, comfortable, a reasonable size and everything worked. Complimentary tea and coffee sachets with a kettle. There was a fridge but it was empty (it would have been nice to have had a complimentary bottle of water and a soft drink cold and waiting!). Room price was very good - under £50.00 (€52.00) per night room only. Breakfast was inexpensive; typical continental fare; the coffee is however vile in the machine. I suggest you make your own tea. I had dinner in the hotel, once only. It's OK, inexpensive but nothing to get too excited about. The bar is also OK. there is no pool at this hotel and its location is kind of outside the centre of anything happening so be prepared to go elsewhere for anything. Taxis cruise past regularly so there is no waiting. Staff are very pleasant and smile - what a nice change it makes to have efficient and courteous staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: DB129
Reviews.Content: First of all, anyone booking at the Holiday Inn Express should not expect the Ritz. Also, during my 2-week stay, I had a rental car and my company paid for the internet. That being said, the value for money at the Holiday Inn is very good. The breakfast is pretty basic (cereal, fruit, yogurt, toast/danishes) but how many other places in Dubai provided a complimentary breakfast? The location is good between and central to most of the attractions and shopping around Dubai. Parking was free and security at the gate prevented anyone other than guests from using the parking garage. When I did need a taxi, the security at the front was able to flag one down for me quickly. Also, the service at the front desk, housekeeping and the restaurant were fantastic. Everyone was quick to please and very welcoming with information and requests. The only other things that I would note is that there is not an ironing board in the room, although the front desk was very quick to send one to my room when requested (within 10-15 minutes). And, the restaurant doesn't actually do room service to the room, but were very nice in covering up the meal and placing it on a tray so that I could bring it up to the room. Lastly, there isn't a pool, but there is a gym. I didn't use it as the location next to Safa Park was perfect for a run, but it looked decent. Overall, good hotel and I'll definitely consider staying here if I return.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice&new rooms, basic breakfast”
Reviews.Author: raqqq
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel, rooms are not very big but everything is still pretty new. Breakfast is a bit basic, but still good enough if you are staying for a short period and do not mind eating the same sutff 2 or 3 times. Location is OK, pretty close to metro station (15 minute walk), however you may prefer to grab a taxi - especially when carrying luggage. Burj Khalifa and Dubai Mall is only one metro stop away, but then you still need to walk for about 20 minutes - which is not a pleasure during summer in Dubai. Great plus is that they allowed us to check in early before 9 AM.

Reviews.Title: “Nice,clean hotel. Would recommend for a breif stay.”
Reviews.Author: lazerduze
Reviews.Content: Overall, I would say the hotel is okay for a few nights stay. Expect nothing fancy, however. The location was okay, but you would need a car or cab to get you to places, especially during the summer months (like even Dubai Mall, although it's very close). We tried taking the metro, but thought the 10 mins walk to the metro and the 4 Dhs. pass for one stop ride to Dubai Mall was really not worth it. Ended up taking a cab the next few times and it cost us about 15 Dhs. Did not try the breakfast, so can't comment on that. Parking was REALLY tight, especially since hubby was driving a big car. For driving a car such a Honda Civic or Corolla, I don't anticipate parking issues, although the parking does fill up quick on the weekends. Nonetheless, they do have two floors.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money”
Reviews.Author: nomy_d
Reviews.Content: i was making reservation for that hotel like last summer&i was surprised 2 see some bad reviews about it&although me&my wife stayed there last year but i decieded 2 write my review now.it was real value 4 money&they give free breakfast&we rented a car during our stay&they provide free otopark

Reviews.Title: “A great stay for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: razwan1982
Reviews.Content: Well guys, I read all the reviews posted on here before booking this hotel. The hotel does have pros and cons as do all others. For me it's a thumbs up ! ! Arrived in the early hours around 2am. No problems with check-in and room was ready&clean. Breakfast is buffet style and for free is more than most hotels would provide. Hotel offers free shuttle bus to jumeriah beach 10am and Dubai mall 1030am with pick-ups at 1430pm & 1500pm respectively. Dubai mall has a waitrose supermarket for those essential room food stock up. Took me around 5mins to walk to the nearest metro stop "business bay" which gets you to the north and south of dubai. Great location to get nearer to other locations and missing heavy traffic. Took 15mins to arrive from airport costing 50aed as get charged extra from airport automatically and was night rate after 10pm. Going back to airport was only 30aed as was day and no airport charge. Final words. Hotel in good location. Mid point to Dubai city centre and the palm jumeriah. Staff at hotel were great. Friendly and helpful. Shuttle bus driver gives great advice on getting around Dubai and sights to see. Waitress at breakfast was cool as she always made sure that we got some green tea bags which are not commonly drank in dubai Hope this review is useful and thanks to the hotel staff

Reviews.Title: “A quick one-night stay in Dubai, and Holiday Inn is nice as expected!”
Reviews.Author: wandersmuch
Reviews.Content: Had a quick one-night layover to check out Dubai, and Holiday Inn's tend to be well-done and similar no matter where I stay, which I like. It cost about $12 US to get a taxi to here, but be sure to specify Safa Park (as the driver got confused). Grabbed another taxi to the Dubai Mall/Burj Khalifa and spent the afternoon there! The lobby smelled strongly of smoke, so that put a damper on the experience, and no wifi in rooms, only plug-in and expensive rates, so if you need to do hardcore work, you might want to look elsewhere. Breakfast did the job and quickly got a taxi to the airport the next morning!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, serene, away from city clutter”
Reviews.Author: Kaptainmirza
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Express hotel in Satwa is a delightful retreat for couples. Quiet surroundings comes with peaceful setting inside the hotel make it a comfortable go. Although 2 star, but people with sole purpose to relax and quick makeover, can choose this place. Nice ambiance, the breakfast was okay but no one minds the selection when no one knows where you are.

Reviews.Title: “Look No Further For Value In Dubai”
Reviews.Author: peterandsasa
Reviews.Content: Second time stay here and as is typical with Holiday Inn Express's, it's great value for money. Exceptionally clean and comfortable with very courteous front desk staff. Inclusive breakfast more than adequate. Downside is location if you don't have a car. Although only 100 metres from the main Sheik Zayed Road, taxis can be absent for long periods. No local shops. Holiday Inn Express's business model isn't consistent with other countries where I use them. The hotel for example doesn't have free wifi nor DIY laundry facilities although an iron and board arrived within minutes of asking. Great value for Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: miss_orange13
Reviews.Content: This is a delayed review. However, I would recommend this hotel to non-fussy travelers, who enjoy walking a lot. Husband and I took a cab straight from the airport in the wee hours. Cost was abt 45DHM. This place is tucked away from the main road and is next to the Gulf News building. I think it's relatively new and was very clean. We had a standard room which was pleasant. Even the bathroom was clean and brand new! Was happy but disappointed that it didn't come with a bathtub. It was cold in February but the water heater heated up just fine if you know how to adjust it. I did not take a walk at the Safa Park, which is just nearby. But husband enjoyed his morning run there (there is a mini gym too). The train station (Business Bay) is just a five minutes walk from this hotel so you should have no problems with transportation. A one-way cab fare to or from Dubai Mall costs about 15DHM. Dubai Mall is a train stop away. We got the top-up card for the train/bus and it can be used up to five years. We didn't purchase any buffet from the restaurant and this hotel doesn't serve room service. Therefore, husband and I ate out a lot and bought food in our room. Am hoping to visit Dubai again!

Reviews.Title: “The price is good but it may be worth it to pay a bit more.”
Reviews.Author: Chang_and_Ling
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights in April 2011 at a nightly rate of USD 79++. For the price, it’s fine but I won’t stay here again – like another reviewer, I’d prefer to pay a bit more to avoid some of the annoyances and be closer to the creek. First of all, I’ll say there were no major problems. My complaints were: 1. As another reviewer said, the room was musty and damp which was immediately noticeable but that I thought the aircon would dry out. I complained after the first night and both the housekeeping manager and an engineer quickly identified the problem as a water leak. This was obviously not new (from the bubbled paint) and so I fault them for continuing to use the room. 2. The room I was moved to wasn’t damp but the internet didn’t work. Of course they told me it was my laptop but was finally moved to my third room where everything seemed okay. 3. The aircon worked but not well, and this was only April! 4. Message button on the phone didn’t work and when I called the front desk to get my message, the receptionist said it was a missed call. However, my friend later said she definitely had left a message. 5. Clothes line in the shower was broken. And some complaints would probably be the same at any HI Express but this was the first I'd stayed at. 1. Pillows are a strange, mini size. Other than that, the bed was comfortable. 2. No bar soap, only liquid, in the bathroom. No washcloths either. 3. Hallway noise was very noticeable. Noise from outside was not bad at all. 4. The dirt-hiding color scheme in the room is really depressing. What did I like? The price. Also, most of the staff were professional, courteous, and interested in making my stay pleasant. I would prefer to be closer to the creek, but the location will be good if you plan to spend a lot of time at the beach or Dubai Mall (and Burj Khalifa). The rate included unlimited internet which generally worked well. Finally, the room was clean and fairly new, although the furniture and carpet are starting to show wear.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay and bonus points”
Reviews.Author: Ankitjain
Reviews.Content: staying in Holiday inn is my first priority always as the hotel is very comfortable and above all you can earn some bonus points on each eligible night stay and can convert the points for airlines miles and many more.....dont forget to create your prioirty club membership number before checking in,......we got the place in discount due to the priority club member and the complementary breakfast served by holiday inn is superb.....

Reviews.Title: “Great location 8 minutes walk to Metro station stop.”
Reviews.Author: FEATHERSTONE74
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed here for 4 night from 7Th March 2011 we arrived mid morning to check in, As a Priority Club Platinum Royal Ambassador member we was checked in straight away but was told we had to wait about 10 minutes for the room to be ready which was not a problem to us. We had a great room room double bed with sofa large room But not the best of views to outside facing the gulf news building and on 1st floor, I did ask for a top floor with good view of the downtown area but was told hotel was full. any way we was out all the days sightseeing so it didn't matter. The cleaning of the room is not the fastest one day we never got the bin emptied nor cups cleaned and no teas and coffees replaced, I think they just opened the door looked in and went onto the next room?? so i had to find one of the cleaners and ask for more teas and coffees and a change of towels in bathroom. We ate in the Restaurant on first night and each morning for the free breakfast which was good, They provide a free continental breakfast in the room rate and plenty of choice and kept keeping it restocked as things got eaten. The food in the evening had an OK choice enough to choose from and at a reasonable price for a city hotel, the other nights we would walk 5 to 8 minutes to the Business Bay Metro station and go to the Dubai Mall only 1 stop away (5 min ) or to the Mall of the Emirates which was only minutes away in the opposite direction. Safa Park is only a 5 minuets walk away if you fancy a relaxing stroll or sit in the park to watch the world go by, the hotel also runs a free shuttle bus service to Jumeirah Beach couple times a day. Yes we would stay here again and we loved the location and walking distance to the Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: KeithWS
Reviews.Content: Standard Holiday Express, comfortable room with air conditioning, cosy bar area. Continental buffet breakfast included in room price, restaurant served a fixed price buffet style evening meal. The hotel staff are extremely professional and pleasant. The hotel runs a free shuttle service to the Dubai Mall and the beach, one return trip per day which has to be pre booked with reception. The Dubai Mall is one stop down from Business Bay which is the closest metro station (red line) but this is a 5 minute walk which, because the condition of the pavement (or lack of it) and trying to cross a busy road junction could be difficult if travelling with a heavy suitcase and in the heat of the summer months. However, the hotel can be reached direct from the airport terminal on the Metro for Dirham 2.35! This hotel is primarily designed for business travellers and it serves this market well, however some guests were plainly tourists which if one was expecting sand and sea they would be disappointed, Jeremiah beach is about a 30 minute walk from the hotel but there are plenty of taxis hanging around. With the closeness of the new Metro which is very cheap and convenient all the shopping malls and Deria City are just a short ride away. Tip: get the Gold or Silver preloaded metro travel card, it’s very convenient if you choose to use the Metro regularly.

Reviews.Title: “"no frills hotel"”
Reviews.Author: Amit_Talele
Reviews.Content: Located close to the main road. The rooms are reasonably clean, but too small. The place is ok if you are on a tight budget or else there are many options available for a slightly higher budget. They do not offer room service. Breakfast spread is ok - frankly you could avoid it and head to the food court across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: EBT3
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at the Holiday Inn Safa Park, and had a wonderful time there. The value of the hotel was there in the service we got. Breakfast was simple, but enough to start the day and hold you until lunch or early afternoon. They set up some tours for our group. There is a gym there, and it was well worth it to have the email and breakfast package. Nice Bar for a late night drink, a little smokey, but we're in another country. Location was central enough to catch the taxi's out front of the hotel, rarely had to wait for one.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, peaceful hotel”
Reviews.Author: B0nski
Reviews.Content: I found the service was excellent and the staff genuinely helpful and polite. There were cheap taxis on hand whenever I needed them and the staff were more than happy to give me tips on where to go and what to see. The room was very spacious, quiet and clean. The bar fridge was empty but then I ate out every day anyway. I ate dinner in the hotel on the last night and couldn't believe how delicious the fish was! The cold buffet breakfast was typical Middle Eastern fayre which I enjoy (cheese, fruit, cereal, juice, tea etc). The hotel really is well located in that I could take taxis everywhere fairly cheaply. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Horror Stories of very congested Parking”
Reviews.Author: Suggs45
Reviews.Content: Hotel was more than average, experienced value for money. However, the sweetness of low prices was soon forgotten when encountered with one of the most congested parking in the basement. Nearly every other person had serious problems in maneuvering his/her vehicle and a good number scratched, dented or damaged their car. Hotel should be avoided if you have a vehicle to park.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great value for money but bad choice of colours”
Reviews.Author: HazemHussein
Reviews.Content: Judging from my stay in this hotel and comparing it with my previous stay at the Holiday Inn Jumeirah, I believe that this hotel is fairly new, and very well located just off Sheikh Zayed Road and adjacent to Safa Park and also the Metro station. The rooms are clean, modern, but the choice of colours is very depressing with dark brown prevailing. Try to catch the 10 am courtesy bus to the beach, but beware that it only returns you back to the hotel at 2:30pm. The reception /outlet area is not only understaffed, but unfortunately reception staff are not of high caliber and constantly fail to recognize guest by name or by elite status in priority club, which was not the case at Holiday Inn Express Jumeirah

Reviews.Title: “Neat and Clean but expensive”
Reviews.Author: UniverseFlyer
Reviews.Content: The hotel ambience is pretty clean and the reception desk does a good work. However, for internet access (you don't have free wi-fi) they charge which is quite unusual. Breakfast is good. But if you are catching a early flight and want to have a quick bite at 6:00 AM the complementary Breakfast will not be ready and will test your patience. Don't get surprised by their delay. Better, have it in the airport food court itself. I would recommend this hotel for its ambience. Very well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “great stay for price value”
Reviews.Author: vanessaaa041
Reviews.Content: the location was great- a short ride from the airport and since dubai just opened their metro station, the hotel is only like a 7-10 mins walk to the metro station where you can take it almost all of the major tourist attractions! and you can eve take it back from the airport as well- cheaper than a taxi but takes alittle longer ~ half an hour-45 mins. so yea, def a very accessible location and another great thing is that its very well known. so we never had a problem getting a taxi back to the hotel at literally any time of the day or from anywhere. the breakfast was pretty sad. there was no hot food, just bread, pastry, vegetables (tomatoes and cucumbers), cereal and cheeses. so it was very limited for my mom who is lactose. also the breakfast is only from 6:30-9 and then towards the end, it gets so crowded bc its a small section to get food, there's only 1 slow toaster, and 1 coffee maker. so def get there early if you want to eat breakfast. and you have to pay for ethernet internet in your room (15 AED for half an hour..about $4 USD). but their complimentary shuttle to and from the dubai mall and jumeirah beach is convenient.

Reviews.Title: “I liked the hotel, not the service”
Reviews.Author: beeci
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself has nothing to complain about: clean and nice rooms and building. The staff is not that nice, though. The clerks at the front desk wanted us to pay for the stay, that was paid in advance, and the restaurant staff are just beginners. The breakfast itself is quite weak. And there were no wifi in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, room was clean and quiet, breakfast sufficient”
Reviews.Author: teddybeeear
Reviews.Content: I spent the better part of a week here when I sat out to see the Burj Khalifa and ski indoors. For me, it worked very well but I had little to compare it to in Dubai except by way of price. Given the large number of more expensive hotels, this suited me well. My only complaint has to do with the problem of getting around by taxi. To go to either the Dubai Mall or Mall of the Emerites, the taxi must take a round-about way since there is no crossing of Sheik Zaheid Road. Dubai is not pedestrian friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: englishabdullah
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money. Good location less than 5 minutes drive from Burj Khalifa and Dubai Mall. Very convenient basement parking. Rooms were clean and modern, staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was limited but its complementary which now days is very usual at this price level. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great money Value”
Reviews.Author: Foddiiii
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff and good location it is just 20 min. drive to anywhere in Dubai the underground parking is a bit too tight

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: biyioladipo
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hotel for 8 nights with my family including 3 children. Nice rooms, neat clean and the price was just right. Free breakfast nothing fantastic but it comes free. The choices are restricted and monotonous. Downside with the breakfast was that I could not get eggs even when I was willing to pay for it. The greatest compliment goes to the staff of the hotel, they are simply amazing, I can't remember all their names but I can try with some, Wendy, Florida, Ghani, marouf, etc. They all made our stay very comfortable. The hotel is relatively new, so taxis might not readily know the place, but its quite central, not more than 20 minutes from everywhere, though its quite awkward in terms of positioning. Best bet is to tell the taxi driver that the hotel is around Gulf News. Would recommend this to anyone, families can stay quite nice and cost effective.

Reviews.Title: “Not great but it is comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: engineerfazal
Reviews.Content: It is not great but we did not face any troubles there and everything was fine we stayed there as our company find it a suitable for us as it was near to our project.Staff are nice specailly the asian girl.Big thanks to the housekeeping as they always helpful and available for help.The only thing that i might say that do not expect so much as the hotel is a litttle bit small.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay - Would Recommend”
Reviews.Author: EdBlackadder
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice, one night in July and one in August whilst between flights Booked online for £36/night. Clean, efficient, good size room/bathroom, comfy bed, good breakfast - fresh fruit salad, yogurt, toast, coffee, cereals. Alcohol served during specific hours as well as food in bar. About 15 minute taxi ride from airport which cost 35Dhs daytime and 45Dhs at night. Hotel is in an industrial area but not a problem. Make sure that the taxi driver knows where it is. The first one wasn't sure so he had to hunt for it (at my expense) Hotel is fairly basic but fine for a one night stopover

Reviews.Title: “one in a life time experience”
Reviews.Author: yvette543
Reviews.Content: Beautiful place. would like to visit again with my spouse and children. They would have really enjoyed it. The beach was the cleanest beach i ever saw in my life. The malls were huge and exciting to walk through and see so many different stores and even attractions. Going on the different tours and really getting to know the people of dubai and their culture was an event in itself. The employees at the holiday inn where i stay was the best staff you could ever ask for. The only problem was the breakfast was very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, great value, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: TheGumnuts
Reviews.Content: I was recommended this hotel by a friend and decided to try it for a weekend break in Dubai. A great choice if you want a simple place perfectly located for a trip to Dubai Mall and the Burj Khalifa. It's right on Sheikh Zayed Road. Free undercover parking, free breakfast, and a great rate. This isn't a resort by any stretch of the imagination, but certainly a good address to know in Dubai - we'll be back next time we visit Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful staff combined with a free breakfast equals great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: pandbSouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for value for money. We didn't go to Dubai for the beach (coming from South Africa) of for a hotel spa experience - so for us this hotel was perfect for what we were looking for. Everyone was so friendly and corteous. They went out of there way to assist in any way. Rooms are fresh, clean, large and as modern as necessary. Large bed, great linen. Breakfast was included - not a very extensive buffet, but was all we needed (and again, for free!). Restaurant and bar not great, but do-able. Free shuttle bus to and from the hotel to the Dubai Mall/beach once a day. Not a great location - but in general Dubai is not made for walking and we never waited longer than a few minutes for a taxi outside the hotel any time of night/day. (Just a tip - many of the taxi drivers don't know the hotel too well, so when you check in - ask them for a business card of the hotel and then you can show the driver the address). Our only criticism of the hotel which could have had the potential to sour our whole stay (but the hotel was so great that it redeemed itself) was that when we booked we warned them that we would be arriving late at night. We ended up, due to a horrendous queue for passport control, getting to the hotel at 2am - only to find out that there was not room service and the restaurant was closed. First criticism is that they could have warned us. Second criticism is that the person who checked is in was highly unsympathetic to my ravenous husband. Remember there are no restaurants or supermarkets within walking distance! We eventually persuaded them to order pizza for us from Pizza hut! Just a good value for money, very friendly hotel. This hotel was half the price of most of the other hotels. Don't stay anywhere else - rather stay at this hotel and splurge all that money at the malls. Imagine!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service!!”
Reviews.Author: R609
Reviews.Content: We arrived here by cab from the airport so early in the morning (i think it was even before sunrise) & knew that our check-in time was at least 6-7 hours later. After a long connecting flight from Kuala Lumpur to Dubai - Rome, all we wanted was a nice comfortable bed to sleep on... Thanks to 2 of this amazing staff at the reception, we had our rooms in less than an hour. They were very accomodating & patient enough to answer all of our questions about places to visit/eat/transportation/etc... They even help us to make special reservations to enter Burj Al Arab to dine for dinner. Though it was our first visit in this new beautiful modern hotel, we felt that we were treated like regular priviliged customers...

Reviews.Title: “nice and not costy”
Reviews.Author: advocatez
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for one night on 1-1-2009 It was a nice hotel, and not expensive one Very clean the staffs were nice. The location is so good and close to any where in Dubai. We are residence in Abu Dhabi and once the month or each two month we stay at one of Dubai hotels . This hotel I love it really and I did advised many of my friend to go for it and they did. It's nice clean and comfortable and I will come again for sure. This time I may try the Jumirah branch.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive Staff”
Reviews.Author: gohbs
Reviews.Content: Booked online. Stayed in a standard twin room. THE UPs - Located central in Dubai and near to most of the commercial center - Value for money - Clean and modern interior design - Excellent service and friendly staff THE DOWNs - Expensive internet charges - Hidden and out of the main road. Difficult to get a cab - Limited choices of breakfast and restaurant close early - Few restaurant nearby Good for business traveler and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and comfortable but away from the action”
Reviews.Author: akatherina
Reviews.Content: Although it is near Sheikh Zayed Road and central considering the whole of Dubai, it is very difficult to walk anywhere from the hotel. The nearest three metro stops were not yet open and Financial Centre, while reasonably close, was extremely difficult to walk because of highways obstructing the way and having to do very awkward detours. Safa Park is nice but was closed whenever we looked there, and there is hardly anything else to walk to nearby. Breakfast is simple but great. There were many staff around trying to be helpful. The free 10am shuttle to Jumeirah Beach and 10.30am shuttle to Dubai Mall were very handy with a fantastic driver. There are few views to be had and a third of the rooms in this hotel overlook a small courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: laguna33p
Reviews.Content: Very good stay and as expected like any other good holiday inn express. The breakfast is complimentary and the fitness centre is open 24hrs. The only downside was the internet access, they charge you a flat 20aed for 1hour, so if you want to check your email it's still 20aed for a few minutes. Everyone nowadays need internet access when on the go, I think holday inn need to re-think their policy on internet usage.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: AliAlAwadh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located better than the other two Holiday Inn Express hotels available now in Dubai. The hotel is very close to Shaikh Zayed Road. It is really a good value for money in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: noura_alali
Reviews.Content: good location, withing short driving distance to most of attractions in Dubai. clean, nicely furnished rooms. and most importatntly very affordable price. the only thing i didn't like about the hotel is the breakfast, which i found to be very poor. with with this excellent rate, breakfast is no big deal will definitely recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel, clean, but watch out when paying during checkout!”
Reviews.Author: asg79
Reviews.Content: Our stay was just ok at best! we didn't stay at the hotel very much except to sleep and "eat" in the morning. the "continental" breakfast was ok at best, they didn't have much variety at all! some bread, cereal, milk and juice is all you'll get. I liked the clean lobby and entrance areas. The front desk people weren't that friendly, except for a nice Vietnamese girl, unfortunately we saw her only once upon our initial arrival! the others we're not rude per say, but acted clever and tried to rip you off in a sly sort of way. There was also so much noise in the hallways upstairs we even had to call security! We had clearly payed for our room thru Orbitz before leaving for Dubai and even had a print out of our receipt with us. Upon checking out, 2 days later, they said the receipt was invalid and told us it was only a reservation, not an actual receipt! After some arguments we ended up paying for the room (again), just so we could shut those guys up because we weren't going to win our argument. After coming back from our trip we checked our credit card statement and guess what we saw? Obviously, the double charge for our room! After some appealing and disputing several times with our credit card company investigated the matter and kindly refunded our money back. WHAT A HEADACHE!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay, 2 star hotel with a 5 star personality.”
Reviews.Author: monkeyRochdale
Reviews.Content: just got back from the holiday inn express safa park, i travelled with my mother and we stayed in a twin room. It was our first time in dubai and it was ramadan, we wanted to stay at a no frills hotel. We travel a lot and are always on tours and the beach, so we knew we wouldn't spend a great deal of time in our hotel, there is too much to do in Dubai. Our room was modern as the hotel is only 12 months old, was immaculate clean with tea/coffee facilities and a fridge, tv. Could not fault the room, excellent staff made us feel valued and special.We had breakfast included which was just cereal/juices/fruit and toast, not a lot of selection but it wasn't a problem.This hotel is only a 2 star but i feel like in england it could easilly pass as a 4 star. The place is next to safa park and Gulf news(good landmark for taxi drivers) For a £48.00 a night room rate including a breakfast with great staff in a good safe quiet location, free shuttle to the beach and Dubail mall you can't go wrong. Note that the shuttle leaves the hotel once at 10.00am for Jumeriah beach park and at 10.30am for Dubai mall.However if a swimming pool is important to you there isn't one!!.If anyone would like any further information please don't hesitate to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean and great location. Excellent value for money.”
Reviews.Author: EmpireH
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days business and found it conveniently located between the beach, Dubai Mall, the Creek and the Marina. Staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful, rooms clean and modern. Only minor complaint is that the breakfast is very basic.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express Dubai - Safa Park
HotelInfo.Address: Sheikh Zayed Road | Safa Park, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
